My guess is that when you walk the child tree the layout data should be checked
before casting. This is in GridLayout.java line 204 (maybe in the othe layouts
also, i mostly use grid). At the first level there is no problem but if you go
deeper maybe the layout id not anymore a GridLayout so the layoutData is also
diffrent. I had to make a quite complex composite where I reuse some other
composites allready created and one of them has FillLayout.

best regards,
Daniel Taut
It is a programming error to use a GridData with a FillLayout.

You have a TabFolder with a Composite inside that has a FillLayout.  One or 
more of the children of this Composite has a GridData assigned to it.  This is 
a programming error.  Do not assign layout data to children managed by a 
FIllLayout.
*** Bug 105544 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
